case_vignette: A 16-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his host parents for evaluation of a progressively pruritic rash over his shoulders and buttocks for the past 6 months. He recently came to the United States from Nigeria to attend a year of high school. He reports that it has been increasingly difficult for him to read the whiteboard during classes. Physical examination shows symmetrically distributed papules 4–8 mm in diameter, excoriation marks, and patchy hyperpigmentation over his shoulders, waist, and buttocks. There is nontender inguinal lymphadenopathy and several firm, nontender subcutaneous nodules along the right iliac crest. Six skin snip biopsies are taken from the pelvic girdle, buttocks, and thigh, and are then incubated in saline. After 24 hours, microscopic examination shows motile microfilariae.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been dealing with a really itchy rash on my shoulders and butt for the past 6 months.
Have you noticed any patterns or triggers that worsen the rash?
No, it has just been getting worse over time.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for the rash so far?
I haven't mentioned any treatments or medications that I've tried for the rash.
Have you had any similar issues in the past?
No, I haven't had issues like this before.
Is the rash widespread or localized to only your shoulders and butt?
It's mostly on my shoulders, waist, and butt.
Do any of your family members have a history of skin conditions or autoimmune diseases?
I haven't said anything about my family's medical history.
Could you describe the appearance of the rash? Is it red, blistered, scaly, or have any other distinct features?
The rash has bumps that are about the size of pencil erasers, there's also scratch marks and some areas where the skin color is darker over my shoulders, waist, and butt.
Have you experienced any other symptoms besides the rash, such as fever, joint pain, or fatigue?
I have swollen lymph nodes in my groin area and some hard, painless lumps along the right side of my hip.
Have you engaged in any new activities, used new body products, or been exposed to new environments in the past 6 months?
I recently moved to the United States from Nigeria to go to school.
Given your travel history, have you been tested for infectious diseases common in Nigeria that might not be as common in the United States?
Yes, I've had some skin snip biopsies which, after being looked at under a microscope, showed tiny wriggling worms.
Final Diagnosis: Onchocerciasis (River blindness).
